item.title: Long US Bond Yields Could Rise a Bit More, Nordea Says
item.description: Long Treasury yields might have room to rise a little higher from current levels as the Fed might not have finished interest-rate rises, Nordea said.

item.title: Metal Prices Set to End Week Higher Despite Demand Headwinds
item.description: Base metals prices were higher while gold slipped in early London trade, and BMI said “a modest demand recovery in Mainland China in the coming months will support gains in base metal prices.”

item.title: China Shares End Lower Amid Downbeat Investor Sentiment
item.description: Chinese shares ended lower amid downbeat investor sentiment. Beijing’s easing measures “have not been sufficiently robust to neutralize downside risk in the property market nor to stabilize consumer and investor confidence,” Goldman Sachs said.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Eyes Chinese Bid for Nuclear Plant
item.description: Beijing’s offer gives Riyadh leverage in talks with Washington on proliferation.

item.title: Oil Set for Weekly Loss
item.description: Oil prices ticked higher in Europe but were on course for a weekly loss as concerns about easing supply tightness and a cloudy demand outlook have outweighed reduced OPEC output.

item.title: China Offers Tax Breaks to Home Buyers
item.description: China’s finance ministry unveiled tax breaks for people who sell their homes and repurchase another within a year, a move that could push more homeowners to upgrade their housing as the property downturn continues.

item.title: Dollar Has Potential to Firm Against Euro in 3Q
item.description: The dollar has scope to strengthen against the euro in the current quarter, driven by growth divergence between the U.S. and the eurozone economies, SEB said.

item.title: Heineken Sells Russia Business…for $1
item.description: The deal with Russia’s Arnest Group comes after Moscow seized the local assets of Danish beer rival Carlsberg.

item.title: Ericsson and Huawei Renew Licence Deal
item.description: Ericsson has renewed a multiyear global patent cross-licensing pact with Huawei, giving both companies access to each other’s patented, standardized technologies.

item.title: Germany Exits Recession as Economy Stabilises
item.description: Germany left its recession behind in the second quarter, after new data confirmed preliminary results that the economy stalled in the three months to June, but didn’t contract.

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy, the 38-year-old political novice, grabbed the spotlight at the first GOP presidential debate, but there was little sign he or other contenders had found a new strategy for overtaking front-runner Trump.
item.description: Vivek Ramaswamy, the 38-year-old political novice, grabbed the spotlight at the first GOP presidential debate, but there was little sign he or other contenders had found a new strategy for overtaking front-runner Trump.

item.title: Maui County filed a lawsuit against utility company Hawaiian Electric, alleging that its power lines caused recent wildfires on the island---including one that destroyed the town of Lahaina and killed at least 115 people.
item.description: Maui County filed a lawsuit against utility company Hawaiian Electric, alleging that its power lines caused recent wildfires on the island—including one that destroyed the town of Lahaina and killed at least 115 people.

item.title: Mortgage rates pushed to a 22-year high this week with the average 30-year fixed mortgage hitting 7.23%, making it tougher for the housing market to emerge from its stark slowdown.
item.description: Mortgage rates pushed to a 22-year high this week with the average 30-year fixed mortgage hitting 7.23%, making it tougher for the housing market to emerge from its stark slowdown.

item.title: A group of Wall Street firms that lent hundreds of millions of dollars to WeWorkis exploring the possibility ofa bankruptcy filing that could help the company exit from expensive office leases.
item.description: A group of Wall Street firms that lent hundreds of millions of dollars to WeWork is exploring the possibility of a bankruptcy filing that could help the company exit from expensive office leases.

item.title: Subway agreed to be acquired by Roark in a deal that the sandwich chain's CEO said would help spread tens of thousands of new locations around the world.
item.description: Subway agreed to be acquired by Roark in a deal that the sandwich chain’s CEO said would help spread tens of thousands of new locations around the world.

item.title: The plane carrying Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Wagner paramilitary group, crashed as the result of an assassination plot but wasn't shot down by a surface-to-air missile, U.S. officials said.
item.description: The plane carrying Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Wagner paramilitary group, crashed as the result of an assassination plot but wasn’t shot down by a surface-to-air missile, U.S. officials said.

item.title: A court in Moscow extended by three months the pretrial detention of Evan Gershkovich, The Wall Street Journal reporter deemed by the U.S. to be wrongfully held in Russia.
item.description: A court in Moscow extended by three months the pretrial detention of Evan Gershkovich, The Wall Street Journal reporter deemed by the U.S. to be wrongfully held in Russia.

item.title: Declines in tech stocks Tesla and Amazon and in Disney helped push the major indexes lower, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq falling 1.1%, 1.3% and 1.9%, respectively.
item.description: Declines in tech stocks Tesla and Amazon and in Disney helped push the major indexes lower, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq falling 1.1%, 1.3% and 1.9%, respectively.

item.title: The Justice Department sued SpaceX, alleging that the Musk-led company discriminated for years against refugees and others who fled their homelands.
item.description: The Justice Department sued SpaceX, alleging that the Musk-led company discriminated for years against refugees and others who fled their homelands.

item.title: Turkey's central bank raised its key interest rate by 7.5 percentage points as it attempts to correct years of easy-money policies imposed by Erdogan.
item.description: Turkey’s central bank raised its key interest rate by 7.5 percentage points as it attempts to correct years of easy-money policies imposed by Erdogan.
